topic_0003.d: A category denoting a rather broad domain or field of interest, of study, application, work, data, or technology. Topics have no clearly defined borders between each other.

topic_0605.d: The study and practice of information processing and use of computer information systems.

topic_0089.d: The conceptualisation, categorisation and nomenclature (naming) of entities or phenomena within biology or bioinformatics. This includes formal ontologies, controlled vocabularies, structured glossary, symbols and terminology or other related resource.

topic_0091.d: The archival, curation, processing and analysis of complex biological data.

topic_0607.d: Laboratory management and resources, for example, catalogues of biological resources for use in the lab including cell lines, viruses, plasmids, phages, DNA probes and primers and so on.

topic_2258.d: The application of information technology to chemistry in biological research environment.

topic_3063.d: The application of information technology to health, disease and biomedicine.

topic_3071.d: The development and use of architectures, policies, practices and procedures for management of data.

topic_0219.d: Deposition and curation of database accessions, including annotation, typically with terms from a controlled vocabulary.

p.n: Topic||Informatics||Biological databases||Data submission, annotation and curation

topic_0769.d: Biological or biomedical analytical workflows or pipelines.

topic_3077.d: The acquisition of data, typically measurements of physical systems using any type of sampling system, or by another other means.

topic_3263.d: The protection of data, such as patient health data, from damage or unwanted access from unauthorised users.

topic_3345.d: Topic concerning the identity of biological entities, or reports on such entities, and the mapping of entities and records in different databases.

topic_3365.d: The development of policies, models and standards that cover data acquisition, storage and integration, such that it can be put to use, typically through a process of systematically applying statistical and / or logical techniques to describe, illustrate, summarise or evaluate data.

p.n: Topic||Informatics||Biological databases||Data architecture, analysis and design

topic_3366.d: The combination and integration of data from different sources, for example into a central repository or warehouse, to provide users with a unified view of these data.

topic_3489.d: The general handling of data stored in digital archives such as databanks, databases proper, web portals and other data resources.

topic_3571.d: The control of data entry and maintenance to ensure the data meets defined standards, qualities or constraints.

topic_3572.d: The quality, integrity, and cleaning up of data.

topic_3948.d: Immunoinformatics is the field of computational biology that deals with the study of immunoloogical questions. Immunoinformatics is at the interface between immunology and computer science. It takes advantage of computational, statistical, mathematical approaches and enhances the understanding of immunological knowledge.

topic_3068.d: The scientific literature, language processing, reference information, and documentation.

topic_0218.d: The processing and analysis of natural language, such as scientific literature in English, in order to extract data and information, or to enable human-computer interaction.

topic_3070.d: The study of life and living organisms, including their morphology, biochemistry, physiology, development, evolution, and so on.

topic_0610.d: The ecological and environmental sciences and especially the application of information technology (ecoinformatics).

topic_3050.d: The degree of variation of life forms within a given ecosystem, biome or an entire planet.

topic_3174.d: The study of genetic material recovered from environmental samples, and associated environmental data.

topic_3697.d: The ecology of microorganisms including their relationship with one another and their environment.

topic_0621.d: A specific organism, or group of organisms, used to study a particular aspect of biology.

topic_0780.d: Plants, e.g. information on a specific plant genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

topic_0781.d: Study of viruses, e.g. sequence and structural data, interactions of viral proteins, or a viral genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

topic_1317.d: The molecular structure of biological molecules, particularly macromolecules such as proteins and nucleic acids.

topic_0122.d: The elucidation of the three dimensional structure for all (available) proteins in a given organism.

topic_0593.d: An analytical technique that exploits the magenetic properties of certain atomic nuclei to provide information on the structure, dynamics, reaction state and chemical environment of molecules.
ns: Rotational Frame Nuclear Overhauser Effect Spectroscopy

topic_0611.d: The study of matter by studying the interference pattern from firing electrons at a sample, to analyse structures at resolutions higher than can be achieved using light.

topic_2828.d: The study of matter and their structure by means of the diffraction of X-rays, typically the diffraction pattern caused by the regularly spaced atoms of a crystalline sample.

topic_3448.d: The study of matter by studying the diffraction pattern from firing neutrons at a sample, typically to determine atomic and/or magnetic structure.

topic_2229.d: Cells, such as key genes and proteins involved in the cell cycle.

topic_2259.d: The holistic modelling and analysis of complex biological systems and the interactions therein.

topic_2815.d: The study of human beings in general, including the human genome and proteome.

topic_3047.d: The molecular basis of biological activity, particularly the macromolecules (e.g. proteins and nucleic acids) that are essential to life.

topic_3053.d: The study of genes, genetic variation and heredity in living organisms.

topic_0625.d: The study of genetic constitution of a living entity, such as an individual, and organism, a cell and so on, typically with respect to a particular observable phenotypic traits, or resources concerning such traits, which might be an aspect of biochemistry, physiology, morphology, anatomy, development and so on.

topic_3055.d: The genes and genetic mechanisms such as Mendelian inheritance that underly continuous phenotypic traits (such as height or weight).

topic_3298.d: Phenomes, or the study of the change in phenotype (the physical and biochemical traits of organisms) in response to genetic and environmental factors.

topic_3945.d: The study of the process and mechanism of change of biomolecules such as DNA, RNA, and proteins across generations.

topic_3056.d: The distribution of allele frequencies in a population of organisms and its change subject to evolutionary processes including natural selection, genetic drift, mutation and gene flow.

topic_3295.d: Topic concerning the study of heritable changes, for example in gene expression or phenotype, caused by mechanisms other than changes in the DNA sequence.

topic_3173.d: The study of the epigenetic modifications of a whole cell, tissue, organism etc.

topic_3974.d: The study of the epigenetic modifications of a whole cell, tissue, organism etc.

topic_3321.d: The structure and function of genes at a molecular level.

topic_0114.d: Gene structure, regions which make an RNA product and features such as promoters, coding regions, gene fusion, splice sites etc.

topic_0659.d: Non-coding or functional RNA sequences, including regulatory RNA sequences, ribosomal RNA (rRNA) and transfer RNA (tRNA).

p.n: Topic||Biology||Genetics||Molecular genetics||Gene structure||Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA
Topic||Computational biology||Nucleic acids||RNA||Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA
Topic||Computational biology||Molecular genetics||Gene structure||Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA

topic_0798.d: Mobile genetic elements, such as transposons, Plasmids, Bacteriophage elements and Group II introns.

p.n: Topic||Computational biology||Molecular genetics||Gene structure||Mobile genetic elements

topic_3512.d: Transcription of DNA into RNA and features of a messenger RNA (mRNA) molecules including precursor RNA, primary (unprocessed) transcript and fully processed molecules.

topic_0199.d: Stable, naturally occuring mutations in a nucleotide sequence including alleles, naturally occurring mutations such as single base nucleotide substitutions, deletions and insertions, RFLPs and other polymorphisms.

ns: Variable number of tandem repeat polymorphism

topic_3175.d: Variation in chromosome structure including microscopic and submicroscopic types of variation such as deletions, duplications, copy-number variants, insertions, inversions and translocations.

topic_3958.d: A DNA structural variation, specifically a duplication or deletion event, resulting in sections of the genome to be repeated, or the number of repeats in the genome to vary between individuals.

p.n: Topic||Biology||Genetics||Molecular genetics||Genetic variation||Structural variation||Copy number variation
Topic||Computational biology||Nucleic acids||DNA||Structural variation||Copy number variation
Topic||Computational biology||Molecular genetics||Genetic variation||Structural variation||Copy number variation

topic_0203.d: The analysis of levels and patterns of synthesis of gene products (proteins and functional RNA) including interpretation in functional terms of gene expression data.

topic_0749.d: Proteins that bind to DNA and control transcription of DNA to mRNA (transcription factors) and also transcriptional regulatory sites, elements and regions (such as promoters, enhancers, silencers and boundary elements / insulators) in nucleotide sequences.

p.n: Topic||Biology||Genetics||Molecular genetics||Gene expression||Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Topic||Computational biology||Nucleic acids||DNA||DNA binding sites||Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Topic||Computational biology||Nucleic acids||Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs||DNA binding sites||Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Topic||Computational biology||Proteins||Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Topic||Computational biology||Sequence sites, features and motifs||Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs||DNA binding sites||Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Topic||Computational biology||Molecular genetics||Gene expression||Transcription factors and regulatory sites

topic_3308.d: The analysis of transcriptomes, or a set of all the RNA molecules in a specific cell, tissue etc.

topic_3941.d: The study of microbe gene expression within natural environments (i.e. the metatranscriptome).

topic_3320.d: RNA splicing; post-transcription RNA modification involving the removal of introns and joining of exons.

topic_0623.d: Particular gene(s), gene family or other gene group or system and their encoded proteins.Primarily the classification of proteins (from sequence or structural data) into clusters, groups, families etc., curation of a particular protein or protein family, or any other proteins that have been classified as members of a common group.

p.n: Topic||Computational biology||Molecular genetics||Gene and protein families
Topic||Biology||Genetics||Molecular genetics||Gene and protein families||Immunoproteins and antigens
Topic||Computational biology||Proteins||Gene and protein families||Immunoproteins and antigens
Topic||Computational biology||Molecular genetics||Gene and protein families||Immunoproteins and antigens

topic_3959.d: The branch of genetics concerned with the relationships between chromosomes and cellular behaviour, especially during mitosis and meiosis.

topic_3574.d: The study of inheritance in human beings.

topic_3912.d: The application of biotechnology to directly manipulate an organism's genes.

topic_3930.d: A biomedical field that bridges immunology and genetics, to study the genetic basis of the immune system.

topic_3065.d: The development of organisms between the one-cell stage (typically the zygote) and the end of the embryonic stage.

topic_3292.d: Chemical substances and physico-chemical processes and that occur within living organisms.

topic_3297.d: The exploitation of biological process, structure and function for industrial purposes, for example the genetic manipulation of microorganisms for the antibody production.

topic_3368.d: Any matter, surface or construct that interacts with a biological system.

topic_3398.d: The application of biological concepts and methods to the analytical and synthetic methodologies of engineering.

topic_3576.d: Biotechnology applied to the medical sciences and the development of medicines.

topic_3895.d: The application of multi-disciplinary science and technology for the construction of artificial biological systems for diverse applications.

topic_3299.d: The evolutionary processes, from the genetic to environmental scale, that produced life in all its diversity.

topic_0084.d: The study of evolutionary relationships amongst organisms.

topic_3293.d: The study of evolutionary relationships amongst organisms from analysis of genetic information (typically gene or protein sequences).

topic_3944.d: The biological classification of organisms by categorizing them in groups ("clades") based on their most recent common ancestor.

topic_3306.d: The use of physics to study biological system.

topic_3360.d: Objective indicators of biological state often used to assess health, and determinate treatment.

topic_3369.d: The use of synthetic chemistry to study and manipulate biological systems.

topic_3387.d: The study of organisms in the ocean or brackish waters.

topic_3500.d: Animals, e.g. information on a specific animal genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

topic_3573.d: The study of organisms in freshwater ecosystems.

topic_3810.d: Multidisciplinary study, research and development within the field of agriculture.

topic_3855.d: Study of the environment, the interactions between its physical, chemical, and biological components and it's effect on life.  Also how humans impact upon the environment, and how we can manage and utilise natural resources.

topic_3303.d: Research in support of healing by diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease.

topic_0634.d: Diseases, including diseases in general and the genes, gene variations and proteins involved in one or more specific diseases.

topic_3324.d: The branch of medicine that deals with the prevention, diagnosis and management of transmissable disease with clinically evident illness resulting from infection with pathogenic biological agents (viruses, bacteria, fungi, protozoa, parasites and prions).

topic_2640.d: The study of cancer, for example, genes and proteins implicated in cancer.

topic_2840.d: Toxins and the adverse effects of these chemical substances on living organisms.

p.n: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Safety sciences||Toxicology

topic_3300.d: The functions of living organisms and their constituent parts.

topic_3305.d: Topic concerning the the patterns, cause, and effect of disease within populations.

topic_3334.d: The branch of medicine that deals with the anatomy, functions and disorders of the nervous system.

topic_3335.d: The diseases and abnormalities of the heart and circulatory system.

topic_3342.d: 'translating' the output of basic and biomedical research into better diagnostic tools, medicines, medical procedures, policies and advice.

topic_3388.d: The identification of molecular and genetic causes of disease and the development of interventions to correct them.

topic_3396.d: An interdisciplinary field of study that looks at the dynamic systems of the human body as part of an integrted whole, incoporating biochemical, physiological, and environmental interactions that sustain life.

topic_3397.d: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of disease, disorder and injury in animals.

topic_3399.d: The branch of medicine dealing with the diagnosis, treatment and prevention of disease in older people, and the problems specific to aging.

topic_3400.d: Health issues related to the immune system and their prevention, diagnosis and mangement.

topic_3401.d: The prevention of pain and the evaluation, treatment and rehabilitation of persons in pain.

topic_3403.d: The multidisciplinary that cares for patients with acute, life-threatening illness or injury.

topic_3404.d: The branch of medicine that deals with prevention, diagnosis and treatment of disorders of the skin, scalp, hair and nails.

topic_3405.d: The study, diagnosis, prevention and treatments of disorders of the oral cavity, maxillofacial area and adjacent structures.

topic_3406.d: The branch of medicine that deals with the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of disorders of the ear, nose and throat.

topic_3407.d: The branch of medicine dealing with diseases of endocrine organs, hormone systems, their target organs, and disorders of the pathways of glucose and lipid metabolism.

topic_3408.d: The branch of medicine that deals with the blood, blood-forming organs and blood diseases.

topic_3409.d: The branch of medicine that deals with disorders of the oesophagus, stomach, duodenum, jejenum, ileum, large intestine, sigmoid colon and rectum.

topic_3410.d: The study of the biological and physiological differences between males and females and how they effect differences in disease presentation and management.

topic_3411.d: The branch of medicine that deals with the health of the female reproductive system, pregnancy and birth.

topic_3412.d: The branch of medicine that deals with the liver, gallbladder, bile ducts and bile.

topic_3414.d: The branch of medicine that treats body wounds or shock produced by sudden physical injury, as from violence or accident.

topic_3415.d: The branch of medicine that deals with the diagnosis, management and prevention of poisoning and other adverse health effects caused by medications, occupational and environmental toxins, and biological agents.

topic_3416.d: The branch of medicine that deals with the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of disorders of the muscle, bone and connective tissue.  It incorporates aspects of orthopaedics, rheumatology, rehabilitation medicine and pain medicine.

topic_3417.d: The branch of medicine that deals with disorders of the eye, including eyelid, optic nerve/visual pathways and occular muscles.

topic_3418.d: The branch of medicine that deals with the medical care of infants, children and adolescents.

topic_3419.d: The branch of medicine that deals with the mangement of mental illness, emotional disturbance and abnormal behaviour.

topic_3420.d: The health of the reproductive processes, functions and systems at all stages of life.

topic_3421.d: The use of operative, manual and instrumental techniques on a patient to investigate and/or treat a pathological condition or help improve bodily function or appearance.

topic_3422.d: The branches of medicine and physiology focussing on the function and disorders of the urinary system in males and females, the reproductive system in males, and the kidney.

topic_3423.d: Medical therapies that fall beyond the scope of conventional medicine but may be used alongside it in the treatment of disease and ill health.

topic_3575.d: Health problems that are prevalent in tropical and subtropical regions.

topic_3577.d: An approach to medicine whereby decisions, practices and are tailored to the individual patient based on their predicted response or risk of disease.

topic_3307.d: The development and application of theory, analytical methods, mathematical models and computational simulation of biological systems.

topic_0077.d: The processing and analysis of nucleic acid sequence, structural and other data.

ch.n: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs

topic_0097.d: The archival, curation, processing and analysis of nucleic acid structural information, such as whole structures, structural features and alignments, and associated annotation.

p.n: Topic||Computational biology||Nucleic acids||Nucleic acid structure analysis
Topic||Computational biology||Structure analysis||Nucleic acid structure analysis

topic_0654.d: DNA sequences and structure, including processes such as methylation and replication.

topic_3125.d: Nucleic acids binding to some other molecule.

p.n: Topic||Computational biology||Nucleic acids||Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs||DNA binding sites
Topic||Computational biology||Sequence sites, features and motifs||Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs||DNA binding sites
Topic||Computational biology||Nucleic acids||DNA||DNA replication and recombination

topic_3176.d: DNA-histone complexes (chromatin), organisation of chromatin into nucleosomes and packaging into higher-order structures.

topic_3511.d: The biology, archival, detection, prediction and analysis of positional features such as functional and other key sites, in nucleic acid sequences and the conserved patterns (motifs, profiles etc.) that may be used to describe them.
topic_3511.n: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs

p.n: Topic||Computational biology||Nucleic acids||Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs
Topic||Computational biology||Sequence sites, features and motifs||Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs

topic_0078.d: Archival, processing and analysis of protein data, typically molecular sequence and structural data.

topic_0108.d: The translation of mRNA into protein and subsequent protein processing in the cell.

topic_0140.d: The study of how proteins are transported within and without the cell, including signal peptides, protein subcellular localisation and export.

p.n: Topic||Computational biology||Proteins||Protein expression||Protein targeting and localisation

topic_0601.d: Protein chemical modifications, e.g. post-translational modifications.

topic_3120.d: Protein sequence variants produced e.g. from alternative splicing, alternative promoter usage, alternative initiation and ribosomal frameshifting.

topic_0123.d: The study of the physical and biochemical properties of peptides and proteins, for example the hydrophobic, hydrophilic and charge properties of a protein.

topic_0128.d: Protein-protein, protein-DNA/RNA and protein-ligand interactions, including analysis of known interactions and prediction of putative interactions.

p.n: Topic||Computational biology||Molecular interactions, pathways and networks||Protein interactions

topic_0820.d: Lipoproteins (protein-lipid assemblies), and proteins or region of a protein that spans or are associated with a membrane.

topic_0821.d: Proteins that catalyze chemical reaction, the kinetics of enzyme-catalysed reactions, enzyme nomenclature etc.

topic_2814.d: Protein secondary or tertiary structural data and/or associated annotation.

topic_0130.d: Protein stability, folding (in 3D space) and protein sequence-structure-function relationships.  This includes for example study of inter-atomic or inter-residue interactions in protein (3D) structures, the effect of mutation, and the design of proteins with specific properties, typically by designing changes (via site-directed mutagenesis) to an existing protein.

p.n: Topic||Computational biology||Proteins||Protein structure analysis||Protein folding, stability and design
Topic||Computational biology||Structure analysis||Protein structure analysis||Protein folding, stability and design

topic_0166.d: Structural features or common 3D motifs within protein structures, including the surface of a protein structure, such as biological interfaces with other molecules.

p.n: Topic||Computational biology||Proteins||Protein structure analysis||Protein structural motifs and surfaces
Topic||Computational biology||Structure analysis||Protein structure analysis||Protein structural motifs and surfaces

topic_0736.d: Protein tertiary structural domains and folds in a protein or polypeptide chain.

p.n: Topic||Computational biology||Proteins||Protein structure analysis||Protein folds and structural domains
Topic||Computational biology||Structure analysis||Protein structure analysis||Protein folds and structural domains

Topic||Computational biology||Structure analysis||Protein structure analysis||Protein disordered structure

topic_3542.d: Secondary structure (predicted or real) of a protein, including super-secondary structure.

p.n: Topic||Computational biology||Proteins||Protein structure analysis||Protein secondary structure
Topic||Computational biology||Structure analysis||Protein structure analysis||Protein secondary structure

topic_3510.d: The biology, archival, detection, prediction and analysis of positional features such as functional and other key sites, in protein sequences and the conserved patterns (motifs, profiles etc.) that may be used to describe them.

p.n: Topic||Computational biology||Proteins||Protein sites, features and motifs
Topic||Computational biology||Sequence sites, features and motifs||Protein sites, features and motifs

topic_3534.d: Binding sites in proteins, including cleavage sites (for a proteolytic enzyme or agent), key residues involved in protein folding, catalytic residues (active site) of an enzyme, ligand-binding (non-catalytic) residues of a protein, such as sites that bind metal, prosthetic groups or lipids, RNA and DNA-binding proteins and binding sites etc.

p.n: Topic||Computational biology||Proteins||Protein sites, features and motifs||Protein binding sites
Topic||Computational biology||Sequence sites, features and motifs||Protein sites, features and motifs||Protein binding sites

topic_0080.d: The archival, processing and analysis of molecular sequences (monomer composition of polymers) including molecular sequence data resources, sequence sites, alignments, motifs and profiles.

topic_0102.d: The mapping of complete (typically nucleotide) sequences. Mapping (in the sense of short read alignment, or more generally, just alignment) has application in RNA-Seq analysis (mapping of transcriptomics reads), variant discovery (e.g. mapping of exome capture), and re-sequencing (mapping of WGS reads).

topic_0157.d: The archival, processing and analysis of the basic character composition of molecular sequences, for example character or word frequency, ambiguity, complexity, particularly regions of low complexity, and repeats or the repetitive nature of molecular sequences.

p.n: Topic||Computational biology||Sequence analysis||Sequence composition, complexity and repeats

topic_0194.d: The integrated study of evolutionary relationships and whole genome data, for example, in the analysis of species trees, horizontal gene transfer and evolutionary reconstruction.

topic_0196.d: The assembly of fragments of a DNA sequence to reconstruct the original sequence.

topic_0632.d: Molecular probes (e.g. a peptide probe or DNA microarray probe) or PCR primers and hybridisation oligos in a nucleic acid sequence.

topic_0081.d: The curation, processing, analysis and prediction of data about the structure of biological molecules, typically proteins and nucleic acids and other macromolecules.

topic_0082.d: The prediction of molecular structure, including the prediction, modelling, recognition or design of protein secondary or tertiary structure or other structural features, and the folding of nucleic acid molecules and the prediction or design of nucleic acid (typically RNA) sequences with specific conformations.

topic_0176.d: The study and simulation of molecular (typically protein) conformation using a computational model of physical forces and computer simulation.

topic_2275.d: The construction, analysis, evaluation, refinement etc. of models of a molecules properties or behaviour, including the modelling the structure of proteins in complex with small molecules or other macromolecules (docking).

topic_0154.d: Small molecules of biological significance, typically archival, curation, processing and analysis of structural information.

topic_0160.d: The archival, detection, prediction and analysis of positional features such as functional and other key sites, in molecular sequences and the conserved patterns (motifs, profiles etc.) that may be used to describe them.

ch.n: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs

p.n: Topic||Computational biology||Sequence sites, features and motifs

topic_0602.d: Molecular interactions, biological pathways, networks and other models.

p.n: Topic||Computational biology||Molecular interactions, pathways and networks

topic_1775.d: The study of gene and protein function including the prediction of functional properties of a protein.

topic_0085.d: The study of gene or protein functions and their interactions in totality in a given organism, tissue, cell etc.

topic_3892.d: The study and simulation of molecular conformations using a computational model and computer simulations.

topic_3314.d: The composition and properties of matter, reactions, and the use of reactions to create new substances.

topic_3332.d: Topic concerning the development and application of theory, analytical methods, mathematical models and computational simulation of chemical systems.

topic_3336.d: The discovery and design of drugs or potential drug compounds.

p.n: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Drug discovery

topic_0209.d: The design and chemical synthesis of bioactive molecules, for example drugs or potential drug compounds, for medicinal purposes.

p.n: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Drug discovery||Medicinal chemistry

topic_3343.d: Collections of chemicals, typically for use in high-throughput screening experiments.

p.n: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Drug discovery||Compound libraries and screening

topic_3370.d: The study of the separation, identification, and quantification of the chemical components of natural and artificial materials.

topic_3371.d: The use of chemistry to create new compounds.

topic_3315.d: The study of numbers (quantity) and other topics including structure, space, and change.

topic_2269.d: The application of statistical methods to biological problems.

topic_3569.d: The application of mathematics to specific problems in science, typically by the formulation and analysis of mathematical models.

topic_3570.d: The study of abstract mathematical concepts.

topic_3316.d: The theory and practical use of computer systems.

topic_0092.d: Rendering (drawing on a computer screen) or visualisation of molecular sequences, structures or other biomolecular data.

topic_3372.d: The process that leads from an original formulation of a computing problem to executable programs.

topic_3473.d: The discovery of patterns in large data sets and the extraction and trasnsformation of those patterns into a useful format.

topic_3474.d: A topic concerning the application of artificial intelligence methods to algorithms, in order to create methods that can learn from data in order to generate an ouput, rather than relying on explicitly encoded information only.

topic_3318.d: The study of matter, space and time, and related concepts such as energy and force.

topic_3344.d: Topic concerning biological science that is (typically) performed in the context of medicine.

topic_0202.d: The study of drugs and their effects or responses in living systems.

topic_0208.d: The influence of genotype on drug response, for example by correlating gene expression or single-nucleotide polymorphisms with drug efficacy or toxicity.

topic_0804.d: The application of information technology to immunology such as immunological processes, immunological genes, proteins and peptide ligands, antigens and so on.

topic_3067.d: The form and function of the structures of living organisms.

topic_3337.d: Repositories of biological samples, typically human, for basic biological and clinical research.

topic_3338.d: Laboratory study of mice, for example, phenotyping, and mutagenesis of mouse cell lines.

topic_3339.d: Collections of microbial cells including bacteria, yeasts and moulds.

topic_3340.d: Collections of cells grown under laboratory conditions, specifically, cells from multi-cellular eukaryotes and especially animal cells.

topic_3341.d: Collections of DNA, including both collections of cloned molecules, and populations of micro-organisms that store and propagate cloned DNA.

topic_3304.d: The study of the nervous system and brain; its anatomy, physiology and function.

topic_3376.d: The discovery, development and approval of medicines.

topic_3373.d: The process of bringing a new drug to market once a lead compounds has been identified through drug discovery.

p.n: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Drug development

topic_3374.d: The process of formulating and administering a pharmaceutical compound to achieve a therapeutic effect.

topic_3375.d: The study of how a drug interacts with the body.

p.n: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Drug metabolism

topic_3377.d: The safety (or lack) of drugs and other medical interventions.

p.n: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Safety sciences

topic_3378.d: The detection, assesment, understanding and prevention of adverse effects of medicines.

p.n: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Safety sciences||Pharmacovigilance

topic_3379.d: The testing of new medicines, vaccines or procedures on animals (preclinical) and humans (clinical) prior to their approval by regulatory authorities.

p.n: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Preclinical and clinical studies
Topic||Experimental design and studies||Preclinical and clinical studies

topic_3393.d: The processes that need to be in place to ensure the quality of products for human or animal use.

p.n: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Quality affairs

topic_3394.d: The protection of public health by controlling the safety and efficacy of products in areas including pharmaceuticals, veterinary medicine, medical devices, pesticides, agrochemicals, cosmetics, and complementary medicines.

p.n: Topic||Biomedical science||Medicines research and development||Regulatory affairs

topic_3966.d: The design of vaccines to protect against a particular pathogen, including antigens, delivery systems, and adjuvants to elicit a predictable immune response against specific epitopes.

topic_3386.d: The use of animals and alternatives in experimental research.

topic_3679.d: The design of an experiment involving non-human animals.

topic_3390.d: The study of the effects of food components on the metabolism, health, performance and disease resistance of humans and animals.  It also includes the study of human behaviours related to food choices.

topic_3395.d: Biomedical approaches to clinical interventions that involve the use of stem cells.

topic_3361.d: The procedures used to conduct an experiment.

topic_3168.d: The determination of complete (typically nucleotide) sequences, including those of genomes (full genome sequencing, de novo sequencing and resequencing), amplicons and transcriptomes.

topic_3169.d: The analysis of protein-DNA interactions where chromatin immunoprecipitation (ChIP) is used in combination with massively parallel DNA sequencing to identify the binding sites of DNA-associated proteins.

topic_3170.d: A topic concerning high-throughput sequencing of cDNA to measure the RNA content (transcriptome) of a sample, for example, to investigate how different alleles of a gene are expressed, detect post-transcriptional mutations or identify gene fusions.

topic_3673.d: Laboratory technique to sequence the complete DNA sequence of an organism's genome at a single time.

topic_3676.d: Laboratory technique to sequence all the protein-coding regions in a genome, i.e., the exome.

topic_3837.d: Approach which samples, in parallel, all genes in all organisms present in a given sample, e.g. to provide insight into biodiversity and function.

topic_3382.d: The visual representation of an object.

topic_3383.d: The use of imaging techniques to understand biology.

topic_3384.d: The use of imaging techniques for clinical purposes for medical research.

topic_3385.d: The use of optical instruments to magnify the image of an object.

topic_3444.d: Techniques that uses magnetic fields and radiowaves to form images, typically to investigate the anatomy and physiology of the human body.

topic_3452.d: Imaging in sections (sectioning), through the use of a wave-generating device (tomograph) that generates an image (a tomogram).

topic_3954.d: A diagnostic imaging technique based on the application of ultrasound.

topic_3516.d: Genotype experiment including case control, population, and family studies. These might use array based methods and re-sequencing methods.

topic_3518.d: Microarray experiments including conditions, protocol, sample:data relationships etc.

topic_3519.d: PCR experiments, e.g. quantitative real-time PCR.

topic_3524.d: Biological computational model experiments (simulation), for example the minimum information required in order to permit its correct interpretation and reproduction.

topic_3656.d: Experimental techniques to purify a protein-DNA crosslinked complex.  Usually sequencing follows e.g. in the techniques ChIP-chip, ChIP-seq and MeDIP-seq.

topic_3179.d: Experimental techniques that combine chromatin immunoprecipitation ('ChIP') with microarray ('chip'). ChIP-on-chip is used for high-throughput study protein-DNA interactions.

topic_3674.d: Laboratory technique to sequence the methylated regions in DNA.

topic_3794.d: An antibody-based technique used to map in vivo RNA-protein interactions.

topic_3934.d: Cytometry is the measurement of the characteristics of cells.

topic_3940.d: Molecular biology methods used to analyze the spatial organization of chromatin in a cell.

topic_3957.d: An experiment for studying protein-protein interactions.

topic_3391.d: The collective characterisation and quantification of pools of biological molecules that translate into the structure, function, and dynamics of an organism or organisms.

topic_0121.d: Protein and peptide identification, especially in the study of whole proteomes of organisms.

topic_0622.d: Whole genomes of one or more organisms, or genomes in general, such as meta-information on genomes, genome projects, gene names etc.

topic_0797.d: The study (typically comparison) of the sequence, structure or function of multiple genomes.

topic_3796.d: Large-scale study (typically comparison) of DNA sequences of populations.

topic_3922.d: A field of biological research focused on the discovery and identification of peptides, typically by comparing mass spectra against a protein database.

topic_3943.d: The reconstruction and analysis of genomic information in extinct species.

topic_3172.d: The systematic study of metabolites, the chemical processes they are involved, and the chemical fingerprints of specific cellular processes in a whole cell, tissue, organ or organism.

topic_3955.d: Experimental approaches to determine the rates of metabolic reactions - the metabolic fluxes - within a biological entity.

topic_3967.d: The study of immune system as a whole, its regulation and response to pathogens using genome-wide approaches.

topic_3678.d: The design of an experiment intended to test a hypothesis, and describe or explain empirical data obtained under various experimental conditions.
